nl.fw.yapool

Class BeanConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.fw.yapool.BeanConfig

  • public class BeanConfig
extends Object
    Methods for configuring pools and (SQL) pool-factories using key-value maps or properties. For example, consider the following properties:
    base.maxAcquireTimeMs = 10
    base.jdbcDriverClass = org.hsqldb.jdbc.JDBCDriver
    small.poolname = SmallPool
    small.maxsize = 3
    small.connection.user = SA
    small.connection.password =
    large.poolname = LargePool
    large.maxsize = 10
    large.connection.user = MyUser
    large.connection.password = secret

    Configuring pools could be done using: 

     base = BeanConfig.filterPrefix(p, "base.");
 small = BeanClone.clone(base);
 small.putAll(BeanConfig.filterPrefix(p, "small."));
 large = BeanClone.clone(base);
 large.putAll(BeanConfig.filterPrefix(p, "large."));
 
 BeanConfig.configure(poolSmall, small);
 BeanConfig.configure(sqlSmallFactory, small);
 BeanConfig.configure(poolLarge, large);
 BeanConfig.configure(sqlLargeFactory, large);
    Further configuration per environment can be arranged by using the method prioritizeSuffix(Map, String).
    Author:
    fwiers

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public static String configure(Object bean,
               Map<?,?> props)
        Calls set-methods in the bean that have names that correspond to the property-keys. All names and keys are compared NOT case sensitive. Two special cases are handled:
        - if the property-key ends with an "S" (for seconds) and there is no such method, a method ending with "Ms" (for milliseconds) will be used if it exists. The property-value is multiplied by 1000 thousand. Only works for int- and long-values.
        - if there is a set-method that takes a map or properties, a map is created using the first Camel-case name of the method. E.g. a method setConnectionProps(Properties p) will receive a map with all values for properties that start with "connection." The keys in this map have "connection." removed.
        See also filterPrefix(Map, String) to prepare the props.
        Parameters:
        bean - The bean to apply the properties to.
        props - The properties to apply to the bean.
        Returns:
        A description of methods for which values were set.

      • configure

        public static Properties configure(Object bean,
                   Map<?,?> props,
                   String prefix,
                   String suffix)
        Applies prefix-filtered and prioritized properties to a bean.
        Parameters:
        bean - The bean to configure with the properties (set to null to configure no bean).
        props - Original properties (remain unchanged).
        prefix - The prefix to filter on (set to null for none).
        suffix - The suffix to prioritize (set to null for none).
        Returns:
        The filtered and prioritized properties.

      • configure

        public static Properties configure(Object bean,
                   Map<?,?> props,
                   String prefix,
                   String suffix,
                   String... filterSuffix)
        Same as configure(Object, Map, String, String) but also removes properties that are listed in the filterSuffix.

      • extract

        public static String extract(Object bean,
             Map<Object,Object> props)
        Opposite function of configure(Object, Map): extracts bean values and puts them in the properties map.
        Returns:
        a description of bean-methods and values

      • firstCharLowerCase

        protected static String firstCharLowerCase(String v)

      • filterPrefix

        public static Map<String,Object> filterPrefix(Map<?,?> props,
                              String prefix)
        Returns a new map containing only the keys that have the prefix. The prefix is removed from the keys. Combine this method with BeanClone.clone(Object) to mix template-values with basic values. See also this class' BeanConfig description.

      • prioritizeSuffix

        public static void prioritizeSuffix(Map<?,?> props,
                    String suffix)
        Sets the properties containing the suffix as default properties. E.g. given the following properties:
        maxsize = 10
        maxsize.test = 4
        maxsize.prod = 20
        Calling this method with suffix .test would set properties:
        maxsize = 4
        maxsize.test = 4
        maxsize.prod = 20
        (i.e. the .test properties take preference).

      • prioritizeSuffix

        public static void prioritizeSuffix(Map<?,?> props,
                    String suffix,
                    String... filterSuffix)
        Same as prioritizeSuffix(Map, String) but also removes properties with a suffix that is listed in filterSuffix.

      • setMethodValue

        public static void putIfNotExists(Map<?,?> props,
